issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

I just upgraded my version of Titanium to 1.4.0 and for some reason, my custom app is not working with the Android emulator, the iPhone on-device testing or for Android Market distribution.

The Android tab isn't there at all on the Run on Device page and it says that my "project is not configured to run for Android" on the Distribution page's Android tab. This wasn't happening before I upgraded.

I can run KitchenSink fine and everything there (on-device and simulator) works fine for Android, but only on the KitchenSink project; not on my custom project. For reference, my Android SDK path is set to /Users/*/Downloads/android-sdk-mac_86/platforms/android-8 .

{html}
fields.summary: App Compilation Broken After Upgrading To 1.4.0

comments.body:
{html}

the path should be set to /Users/*/Downloads/android-sdk-mac_86

in the future please use Q&A or helpdesk for bug reports. Thanks!

{html}

{html}

I've changed the path and created a QA item (below). I also checked with another QA item and it talked about replacing the Android.py file, which I did and that did not help. The previous ticket/bug (http://go.grantd.net/c03iDv) report said the issue had been fixed, but that's not the case.

I can't compile for Android on my custom app at all. I really don't know why I downloaded v1.4 because it has been nothing but trouble for me.

http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/48751/cant-work-with-and...

{html}
